item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeWe Are North DenverDid you know the width of #NavajoNation is approximately 600 miles? That is why we are...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeWe Are North Denver

Did you know the width of #NavajoNation is approximately 600 miles? That is why we are having a 600 mile "Move for the Nation" virtual race to raise funds to he...lp the Navajo Nation through the upcoming winter months.

Looking for compassionate runners walkers, swimmers, joggers, etc. Please tag them here and let them know of our fundraiser. If you don't walk or run, you can do 600 of something and raise money for our mission. We have a fundraising goal of $10,000. Please help us get there by registering today and spreading the word to all the compassionate people in your life.

https://runsignup.com/Race/CO/Anywhere/MovefortheNation (link in bio)

#CompassionateColorado
#compassionunited
#runforcompassion
#MoveforetheNation

See More

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeBucket List Community Cafe Northside DenverOur birthday fundraiser for Bienvenidos Food Bank is going great. ...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeBucket List Community Cafe Northside Denver

Our birthday fundraiser for Bienvenidos Food Bank is going great. Thanks Kathleen, Macky, Sharman and Erika for donating. Bienvenidos gives away enough food f...or 300,000 meals a year. They purchase food from farms and save 180,000 pounds of food from groceries that would have been thrown away. This pandemic has hit people hard and non-profits like Beinvenidos are stepping up. Please donate on the link below and share!

https://www.coloradogives.org/bucketlistcommunitycafe

Sunnyside United Neighbors, Inc
BRUN - Berkeley Regis United Neighbors
Tenn Street Coffee & Books
Bienvenidos Food Bank
North Denver for Social Justice: Organizers

Highland United Neighbors, Inc. (HUNI)
Chaffee Park Registered Neighborhood Organization - CPRNO
RiNo, River North Art District

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverPolicing has always been beyond reform. Policing in this country...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Policing has always been beyond reform. Policing in this country is rotten at the roots. The system must be dug up in its entirety, and a new system that values... human life must replace the violence and corruptness of policing.
#JacobBlake #blacklivesmatter

***
[ID: an instagram post on a yellow background from Son of Baldwin that reads ‚ÄúIf you can shoot an unarmed Black person down in broad daylight, during a pandemic, with the cameras rolling, in a time of protest, when the whole world is specifically watching you to see if it‚Äôs true what Black people have been saying about your murderous rampage‚Äîthat means that you will stop at nothing to murder Black people, justifying any and every response from the rebellion.‚Äù]

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudSweep Planned for Monday at 12th and Acoma Where People Moved After Lincoln Park...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep Planned for Monday at 12th and Acoma Where People Moved After Lincoln Park Sweep

Homeless Whack-a-Mole Is Not An Answer

#SOLUTIONSNOTSWEEPS

...

On Monday morning, August 17th 2020, the City plans to sweep the newly formed camp at 12th and Acoma where residents of the Lincoln Park camp moved after that sweep. When will the City ever learn that homeless whack-a-mole does not work!?? It does not create housing, it does not connect people to the little housing that there is, it does not solve health and safety concerns, it does not make homelessness disappear. We need Solutions Not Sweeps!!*&!

In the early days of COVID the city publicly agreed to ‚Äúnot displace people or their property‚Äù from encampments. Then they back tracked on that‚Ä¶They lied to the community. But there was a standing agreement from the City under the Department of Transportation and Infrastructure (DOTI) that, ‚ÄúDue to the COVID-19 crisis, once the area is cleaned, people experiencing homelessness may return to the cleaned area, if they choose to do so.‚Äù We are demanding they at least follow this agreement!

Even better the City should actually start following the CDC guidance - not sweeping encampments and rather providing necessary sanitation resources.

Displacing everyone even for a day instead of providing sanitation resources, support resources, and ultimately housing is not the answer...But scattering everyone to who knows where is fundamentally not a solution.

We cannot keep pretending homelessness will disappear with sweeps. If we even want homelessness to disappear we have to start fighting for attainable housing for ALL and not fighting the visibility of homelessness.

Be there Monday morning at 12th and Acoma. Demand Solutions Not Sweeps!!!

Note: There is also a planned sweep at 13th and Washington on Tuesday August 18th, as well as a likely swept attempt at 29th and Welton that day.

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeFederal agents on Wednesday night reportedly deployed tear gas and less-lethal munitions at a crowd of...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeFederal agents on Wednesday night reportedly deployed tear gas and less-lethal munitions at a crowd of protesters in Bend, Ore., who had surrounded Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) vehicles after two Mexican immigrants were detained.

thehill.com

Protesters block ICE from detaining two Mexican immigrants for 12 hours

Federal agents on Wednesday night reportedly deployed tear gas and less-lethal munitions at a crowd of protesters in Bend, Ore., who had surrounded Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) vehicles after two Mexican immigrants were detained.Federal agents on Wednesday night reportedly deployed tear gas and less-lethal munitions at a crowd of protesters in Bend, Ore., who had surrounded Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) vehicles after two Mexican immigrants were detained.
